concept.title: Fallback ID Methods
concept.shortdesc: If other visitor ID methods fail, Adobe sets a fallback cookie or uses a combination of IP address and user agent to identify the visitor.

section.title: Fallback Visitor Identification Method
section.p: AppMeasurement for JavaScript 1.x and JavaScript H.25.3 (released January 2013) contain a new fallback visitor identification method for visitors whose browser blocks the cookie set by Adobeâ€™s data collection servers (called s_vi). Previously, if a cookie could not be set, visitors were identified using a combination of the IP address and user agent string during data collection.

With this update, if the standard s_vi cookie is unavailable, a fallback cookie is created on the domain of the website with a randomly generated unique ID. This cookie, named s_fid, is set with a 2 year expiration and is used as the fallback identification method going forward. This change should result in increased accuracy in visit and visitor counts in situations where the primary cookie (AMCV_ or s_vi) cannot be set.
Visits total includes all visitors that are identified by the s_vi cookie or by using a fallback method.

section.title: IP Address, User Agent, Gateway IP Address
section.p: . If the AMCV_ or s_vi and the s_fid cookies cannot be set, visitors are identified using a combination of IP address and User Agent.
